text:
Four Naxals, including a commander-rank cadre, were on Friday arrested from two different locations in the insurgency-hit Bastar region in Chhattisgarh, the police said. Three rebels, who were involved in torching vehicles at Hahaladdi iron ore mine, were nabbed from Karremarka village in Kanker district, a senior police official told PTI. Those arrested were identified as Budheshwar Netam (25), Dharmuram (28) and Somji Nareti (20), he said.

In the second incident, Veko Budhru (25), active as Local Guerilla Squad deputy commander in Bhairmagarh area committee was arrested in Dantewada district. - PTI
title: Four Naxals held in Chhattisgarh
